This is nothing more than some kind of viral ad campaign for Nokia.

See http://www.conspiracyforgood.com/, the are the ones spreading this. Then go to http://www.conspiracyforgood.com/rules and click the 'Terms of Service' and 'Privacy Policy' links.

In case they change it, those links lead to https://account.nokia.com/acct/public/termsAndConditions?serviceId=Ovicom&tlang=en&country=GB and https://account.nokia.com/acct/public/privacyPolicy?tlang=en&country=GB
So the pirate party is conspiring with nokia...
Meh, doubt it. TPB probably had no clue it was an ad campaign when they wrote this: http://static.thepiratebay.org/legal/bwb_mail_resp.txt

It still stuns me how good this clip looks. There's lots of money spend on it. And it is unlikely to be the only one ever made.

I can only imagine how much money is spend on making clips like this, let alone lobbying all together. And since a corporation is only created for generating stakeholders value, there's some sort of "return of investment" calculation somewhere, which states there's much more money to be made then this lobbying and film making costs.

When surveillance becomes profitable, and it clearly is, is it weird we see so much of it?

K4YCee works for the film company who created it, and the whole lawsuit email was another clever ploy that was created in order to spread the word about the film. **WARNING**- If you are like me you read the comments b4 d/l. If you do then you may get the impression that the d/l is a n*&ia ad. Why would a company block out the name of a cell phone if the presentation was to be for government eyes only? Thatsx just stupid. It is showing you can use off the shelf tech. That is smart. However I see other mobile phones and laptops and other devices that arent n*&ia. Did S*#y, n*&ia, Sam$%^g, iP%$e. all gang up to create one ad? No they didnt. What those comments are is employees of BlackwellBriggs who were told to quickly come up with a way to make people think it wasnt real. This is some real bad shit if it is real. Think of the tv series person of interest where a computer monitors behavior for possible   
violent tendencies, they monitor everything and compile lists and correlate data and knock knock someones at your door to arrest you for something you may do. Be very afraid of this technology.
